articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Art Performance Given by KPA Navy Ensemble
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Art Performance Given by KPA Navy Ensemble
Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il, together with servicepersons enjoyed an art performance given by the Song and Dance Ensemble of the KPA Navy Command on the occasion of the Socialist Constitution Day.
					 The song and dance ensemble put on the stage such colorful numbers as a serial song "The General and Seamen", dance "Departure from Port in Morning," male chorus "Push back Frontiers of Science".
					
					 The performers successfully represented the invincible might of the heroic KPA which has grown to be a matchless army under the care of Kim Jong Il, illustrious commander born of Heaven, and the firm faith and will of the servicepersons to devotedly defend the headquarters of the revolution and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche with arms.
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the splendid performance replete with the revolutionary soldier spirit given by the artistes of the Song and Dance Ensemble, highly appreciating their achievements made in the performing activities for instilling the conviction of sure victory and optimism and the spirit and courage to annihilate the enemy into the servicepersons.
					
					 He expressed expectation and conviction that the artistes would conduct dynamic revolutionary and militant performing activities to encourage the servicepersons and people in their sacred struggle for defending the socialist system, a precious gain won by the Korean people at the cost of blood.
					
					 Among the audience were KPA General Kim Jong Gak, member of the NDC of the DPRK and first vice director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, KPA General Ri Yong Ho, chief of the KPA General Staff, KPA Generals Kim Won Hong and Hyon Chol Hae, Col, General Jong Myong Do, commander of the KPA Navy, and other commanding officers of the army, Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Pak Nam Gi and Kim Yang Gon, department directors of the C.C., the WPK, and other leading officials of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Meeting Held at DPRK Embassy in Russia
articles.content:
Meeting Held at DPRK Embassy in Russia
Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held at the DPRK embassy in Moscow on Dec. 23 on the occasions of the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 92nd birth anniversary of anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk.
					 Present there were officials of the State Duma, the Foreign Ministry and the Defense Ministry of Russia, the "Russian Railways" Company, the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, officials in the fields of media and culture and arts and Yazov, former minister of defense of the Soviet Union.
					
					 The participants placed a floral basket and bouquets before a full-length picture of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 They looked round photos and books put on display under the themes "Kindling Torch of Great Revolutionary Surge" and "Kim Jong Suk, Mother of Korea".
					
					 Speeches were made.
					
					 The DPRK ambassador to Russia referred to the vigorous drive being waged by the Korean people to fling open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation in 2012, the centenary of birth of the President, closely rallied around Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The DPRK-Russia relations are developing on good terms in accordance with the joint documents signed by the top leaders of the two countries and in the spirit of the inter-state treaties, he added.
					
					 The chairperson of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia said the Korean people have registered shining successes in the confrontation with the U.S. as they are holding Kim Jong Il as the great leader. All the achievements made by the Korean people are entirely ascribable to his leadership, the chairperson added.
					
					 The chairperson expressed conviction that the heroic Korean people closely rallied around Kim Jong Il would achieve shining victory in building a thriving socialist nation in the future, too.

articles.title: Papers Editorially Observe Constitutional Day
articles.content:
Papers Editorially Observe Constitutional Day
 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- Leading papers Sunday call for eternally glorifying our socialist country as an invincible power in editorials marking the 37th anniversary of the promulgation of "Socialist Constitution of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea" by President Kim Il Sung. 
					Rodong Sinmun says that the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il's history of building a rich and powerful country is a history of their Songun revolutionary leadership and the DPRK is an invincible socialist state winning one victory after another while demonstrating its strongest might under the banner of Songun.
					
					 The DPRK is an invincible socialist power emerging ever-victorious with the matchless military power as a mainstay and the best people-centered socialist state enabling in a fully responsible manner the people to fully enjoy genuine rights and an independent and creative life as the master of the state and society, the paper notes, and goes on:
					
					 The DPRK invariably enforced state popular policies even during the difficult period of "the Arduous March," the forced march, and has firmly adhered to the principle of giving priority to everything popular.
					
					 It is a powerful socialist state vigorously advancing with the might of single-minded unity of all the servicepersons and people around the headquarters of the revolution.
					
					 It is the true picture of our society pervaded with the spirit of single-minded unity that they defend the headquarters of the revolution politically and ideologically and with their lives and carry through the plans and intentions of Kim Jong Il with do-or-die will.
					
					 The paper calls for strengthening and developing the Workers' Party of Korea, the army and the state into the eternal party, army and state of Kim Il Sung and boundlessly glorifying the Kim Il Sung Constitution as the nation's treasure of lasting value as it codifies his idea of nation-building and exploits.
					
					 Minju Joson underscores the need for all to thoroughly apply the Socialist Constitution in all fields of revolution and construction with great national pride and self-confidence and thereby defend and eternally glorify the socialist system in the DPRK centered on the popular masses, the best one in the world.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Moves against Creation of Union Protested
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Moves against Creation of Union Protested
 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The Government Employees' Union of south Korea protested against the authorities' moves to hold in check the creation of a union, according to CBS of south Korea.
					 The organization accused the Ministry of Labor of turning down at last an application for creating a union on Dec. 24, terming this an action of supporting the present regime's scheme to brand the above-said union as "an illegal organization."
					
					 The authorities' scheme to prevent the government employees from creating a union would meet a strong protest from all the unionists and civic and public organizations and workers, the organization warned.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Prosecution Indicts Lawmaker from "Democratic Party"
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Prosecution Indicts Lawmaker from "Democratic Party"
 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The Seoul Central District Prosecutor's Office of south Korea on Dec. 23 indicted Paek Won U, lawmaker from the "Democratic Party," on the charge of "disturbing a funeral".
					 The authorities took such action for the mere reason that he described the present "government's" act of driving the former "president" to death as a "political retaliation" and urged it to apologize for that act.

articles.title: Settlement of Tragedy in Ryongsan Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Settlement of Tragedy in Ryongsan Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- A rally took place in Ryongsan, Seoul on Dec. 24 to honor the memory of evacuees killed by the fascist authorities.
					 It was attended by bereaved families and members of civic and public organizations.
					
					 Speakers at the rally accused the "government" of failing to probe the truth about the killing and punish the main culprit though it is nearly one year since the tragedy in Ryongsan.
					
					 They demanded that the authorities immediately settle the tragedy.

articles.title: Solidarity Expressed with Korean People
articles.content:
Solidarity Expressed with Korean People
Pyongyang, December 27 (KCNA) -- The DPRK has turned into an invincible socialist power thanks to the Songun politics, a unique political mode of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Miroslav Stepan, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party, said this when meeting the DPRK ambassador to the Czech Republic on Dec. 21.
					
					 Such miraculous successes made in the DPRK as the introduction of UHP electric arc furnace and the completion of the Juche iron production system and the introduction of CNC technology with the efforts and technology of Koreans are the fruition of Kim Jong Il's energetic leadership, he said, adding that this powerfully encourages all the progressive people of the world.
					
					 He expressed support and solidarity with the Korean people in their struggle to build a thriving socialist nation and achieve the peaceful reunification of the country.
